text:
If ai speeds up work or even regularly does a single task, that displaces jobs.

Reduced workload -> reduced headcount
I'm replacing my job with AI, I just hope my boss doesn't find out for a few decades.

Sure they will, at least a large portion of them. Maybe not full time but much of the time. 

Those with access to superior technology and resources will excel and do better than those without. AI teacher can go home with you and explain your homework on a Saturday.

Then it's time for lots of playing-gaming, paired with regular learning activities such as reading, writing, learning languages, learning to do math with our brains, learning to play instruments, etcetera.

Even if we individually have super duper AI assistants that doesn't mean our fatty watery computers don't need development and training because that's just the way they have been for millenia. If we don't want that anymore then we just replace regular humans with androids, or not even, I don't know.

You’re still on with the Strawman though. I haven’t at any point suggested that we replace school staff with AI.

I’m just saying that AI will be able to teach kids-older people better than the average teacher. And because of this, education will change.
